content:
• Thursday, June 27, 2013
  • SPR

    Spirit AeroSystems (NYSE:SPR) receives a $60M contract from Sikorsky Aircraft to supply the...

    Spirit AeroSystems (NYSE:SPR) receives a $60M contract from Sikorsky Aircraft to supply the major structural cockpit and cabin components of four additional CH-53K heavy lift helicopters. Designated System Demonstration Test Articles, the four production-representative aircraft will be used by the U.S. Marine Corps to evaluate the helicopter's mission capabilities under operating conditions. Shares -2.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:40 PM
  • CAMP

    More on CalAmp (NASDAQ:CAMP): Q1 beats across the board on a 22.5% jump in total sales. Wireless...

    More on CalAmp (NASDAQ:CAMP): Q1 beats across the board on a 22.5% jump in total sales. Wireless Datacom revenue up 29% over prior year Q1 to $40.9M. For Q2, the company projects its EPS to come in around $0.14 to $0.18 per share on revenues in the range of $53M to $57M. That's in line with the $0.16 per share in earnings on $53.7M in revenue expected by the Street. Shares +1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:20 PM
  • TLRA

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TRMR +14%. MCP +10%. G +8%. GTI +3%. NKE +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TRMR +14%. MCP +10%. G +8%. GTI +3%. NKE +3%.
    After-hours top losers: STRI -11%. VOXX -8%. ACN -7%. WNC -6%. SFI -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • PFE

    Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) authorizes a new $10B stock repurchase program in addition to the $3.9B of...

    Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) authorizes a new $10B stock repurchase program in addition to the $3.9B of authorization remaining under its current buyback program. Shares +1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP) +4.6% AH on news the SEC completed its investigation into the accuracy of the...

    Molycorp (MCP) +4.6% AH on news the SEC completed its investigation into the accuracy of the company's public disclosures with no enforcement action recommended.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • NKE

    Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ4 EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $6.7B (+7% Y/Y) beats by $0.06B....

    Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ4 EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $6.7B (+7% Y/Y) beats by $0.06B. Shares +1.86% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM

  • Oxygen Biotherapeutics (OXBT -2.7%) rebounds from a bigger hit earlier today after reporting a...

    Oxygen Biotherapeutics (OXBT -2.7%) rebounds from a bigger hit earlier today after reporting a full-year 2013 loss of $6.68 per share, more than half the 2012 loss $14.07 per share as operating expenses were reduced by 26% and net operating losses narrowed by 37%. Revenue came in at $1.1M, compared to $363,781 reported in 2012. Government grant revenue increased 263% Y/Y to $1.14M, due to progress on underlying studies for Oxycyte and the achievement of contractual milestones under the grant.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • CAMP

    CalAmp (NASDAQ:CAMP): Q1 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $53.7M (+22.5% Y/Y) beats by...

    CalAmp (NASDAQ:CAMP): Q1 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $53.7M (+22.5% Y/Y) beats by $1.29M. Shares +2.36% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • ACN

    Accenture (NYSE:ACN): FQ3 EPS of $1.14 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $7.2B misses by $0.22B. Shares...

    Accenture (NYSE:ACN): FQ3 EPS of $1.14 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $7.2B misses by $0.22B. Shares -3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • ERF

    Enerplus (ERF +3.4%) agrees to sell ~C$80M of non-core assets in Canada to multiple parties but...

    Enerplus (ERF +3.4%) agrees to sell ~C$80M of non-core assets in Canada to multiple parties but maintains its 2013 production guidance, given strong operational performance to date. ERF expects annual production volumes will average ~85K boe/day, at the high end of its previous guidance range.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 2 Comments
  • NAVB

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NAVB +4.7%) trades up today after reporting results of its 2013...

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NAVB +4.7%) trades up today after reporting results of its 2013 Annual Meeting of Stockholders held earlier today. NAVB made a series of presentations to shareholders highlighting Lymphoseek's U.S commercialization and indication expansion development activities, selection of a specialty pharma partner for its commercialization in Europe, and initiation of a pivotal NAV4694 Phase 3 registration study.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 4 Comments
  • PTCT

    Recently public PTC Therapeutics (PTCT -15.9%) plummets after a negative article published at...

    Recently public PTC Therapeutics (PTCT -15.9%) plummets after a negative article published at PLOS Biology and a subsequent piece by SA contributor Prop Think question the efficacy of ataluren, the company's lead product candidate.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS -3.7%) slips today after saying it's mailed a letter to stockholders advising them...

    Vivus (VVUS -3.7%) slips today after saying it's mailed a letter to stockholders advising them to vote against First Manhattan's slate of directors, saying "A vote for FMC and Sam Colin equals increased RISK." That risk, the company says, includes threatening ongoing Qsymia commercialization efforts, as well as jeopardizing discussions VVUS is currently having with large pharmaceutical companies to increase primary care physician outreach. Read the full letter here: VVUS Letter to Stockholders.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • HQCL

    Hanwha SolarOne (HSOL +12.2%) soars after securing a $100M term loan facility from the...

    Hanwha SolarOne (HSOL +12.2%) soars after securing a $100M term loan facility from the Export-Import Bank of Korea at LIBOR plus 199 basis points. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • PTLA

    Portola Pharmaceuticals (PTLA +10.1%) moves up after saying late yesterday that it had entered...

    Portola Pharmaceuticals (PTLA +10.1%) moves up after saying late yesterday that it had entered into a clinical collaboration agreement with Daiichi Sankyo (OTCPK:DSNKY) to conduct a Phase 2 study of its investigational Factor Xa inhibitor antidote PRT4445, or andexanet alfa. The study will at several different doses to reverse the anticoagulant effects of Daiichi Sankyo's edoxaban in healthy volunteers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • APD

    BAML downgrades Air Products (APD -2.9%) to Underperform from Neutral in a valuation call, as...

    BAML downgrades Air Products (APD -2.9%) to Underperform from Neutral in a valuation call, as the stock has pushed through the firm’s $90 price target, making it less attractive on a risk/reward basis. The tone has been less enthusiastic in recent quarterly reports, with management trimming guidance and revenue often missing forecasts.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • NOK

    Volatile Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +7.5%) is among the day's big winners; today's gains come 3 days...

    Volatile Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +7.5%) is among the day's big winners; today's gains come 3 days after shares fell 7% during a market rout. Alcatel announced overnight #3 Italian mobile carrier Wind (22M mobile subs + 3M wireline subs) has tapped the company to provide a "network transformation solution" that includes its 100G optical transmission systems, related optical switches, and 7750 edge router.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • GSK

    GlaxoSmithKline (GSK +0.4%) receives "verbal notification" from the FDA that its DMD treatment...

    GlaxoSmithKline (GSK +0.4%) receives "verbal notification" from the FDA that its DMD treatment Drisapersen has been granted Breakthrough Therapy designation. This is good news for Prosensa, which has licensed the development of the drug to GSK and potentially bad news for Sarepta (SRPT -3.8%) whose Eteplirsen is widely expected to receive the designation for the same indication. Deutsche — which weighed in yesterday on the issue — says SRPT's treatment could still get an FDA nod.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 3 Comments
  • PTLA

    Portola Pharmaceuticals (PTLA +10.1%) moves up after saying late yesterday that it had entered...

    Portola Pharmaceuticals (PTLA +10.1%) moves up after saying late yesterday that it had entered into a clinical collaboration agreement with Daiichi Sankyo (OTCPK:DSNKY) to conduct a Phase 2 study of its investigational Factor Xa inhibitor antidote PRT4445, or andexanet alfa. The study will at several different doses to reverse the anticoagulant effects of Daiichi Sankyo's oral direct Factor Xa inhibitor edoxaban in healthy volunteers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • GNC

    GNC Holdings (GNC -3%) drops, perhaps on a report out of ITG research suggesting Q2 revenue may...

    GNC Holdings (GNC -3%) drops, perhaps on a report out of ITG research suggesting Q2 revenue may come up short thanks to membership pricing concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • LEU

    USEC (USU -7.8%) shareholders approve a 1-for-25 reverse stock split effective after the close...

    USEC (USU -7.8%) shareholders approve a 1-for-25 reverse stock split effective after the close on July 1, a move to enable USEC to regain NYSE continued listing requirements and broaden the appeal of the stock to investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • CERE

    Shares of Cere (CERE +29.4%) soar today on no specific news driver. Although the company says it...

    Shares of Cere (CERE +29.4%) soar today on no specific news driver. Although the company says it isn't aware of any catalyst, it's worth noting that CERE is a biotech company that markets seeds for energy crops used in the production of renewable transportation fuels, electricity and bio-based products, and one of the presentations yesterday at the ACT Expo focused on ways to cut petroleum use over the next 20 years.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • CSIQ

    Volatile solar stocks are rallying today (TAN +1.8%) after taking it on the chin earlier this...

    Volatile solar stocks are rallying today (TAN +1.8%) after taking it on the chin earlier this week thanks to Chinese macro concerns. In addition to GT Advanced (previous), big winners include Canadian Solar (CSIQ +9.3%), JinkoSolar (JKS +10.4%), LDK (LDK +4.5%), and Trina (TSL +4.4%). CSIQ is now up 23% over the last two days, after jumping yesterday in response to its Samsung deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • N

    William Blair starts coverage on NetSuite (N +3.8%) with an Outperform, sending shares above $92...

    William Blair starts coverage on NetSuite (N +3.8%) with an Outperform, sending shares above $92 a day after the company announced a cloud ERP/HR software tie-up with Oracle aimed at mid-sized businesses. Several analysts have praised the deal, generally for increasing NetSuite's distribution/addressable market size.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • WPRT

    Shares of Westport Innovations (WPRT +8.9%) rise again today, pushing the shares up 14% over the...

    Shares of Westport Innovations (WPRT +8.9%) rise again today, pushing the shares up 14% over the past two sessions. Today's rise might be attributed to upbeat comments made in a keynote speech by UPS at the ACT Expo in Washington, DC. The delivery giant commited earlier this year to using liquefied natural gas trucks, powered by Westport HD Systems, in interstate operations for its Ontario, California to Las Vegas, Nevada route.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 4 Comments
  • CHTR

    Cable stock frenzy: Shares of Time Warner Cable (TWC +7.8%) spike higher off of a Bloomberg...

    Cable stock frenzy: Shares of Time Warner Cable (TWC +7.8%) spike higher off of a Bloomberg headline indicating Liberty Media (LMCA +2.5%) is interesting in making a bid. Cablevision (CVC +7.8%) and Charter Communications (CHTR +5.9%) are also on the move.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 2 Comments
  • GLD

    Gold's (GLD -0.9%) tumbled to new bear market lows in the last few minutes, now just a few...

    Gold's (GLD -0.9%) tumbled to new bear market lows in the last few minutes, now just a few dollars above $1,200 per ounce. When all else fails, check with the technicians - one isn't seeing support until the $1,150 area.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM | 51 Comments
  • AEGN

    Aegion (AEGN +2.6%) gains after saying its Insituform Technologies unit has been awarded a $16M...

    Aegion (AEGN +2.6%) gains after saying its Insituform Technologies unit has been awarded a $16M contract from the City of Baltimore, Maryland to install over 170K feet of its small- and medium-diameter pipe in wastewater pipelines located in urban areas in the north and east portions of the city. Work is expected to begin in Q3, and will take approximately 16 months to complete. Since last December, the City of Baltimore has awarded Insituform over $46M in contracts.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • SGRP

    Midday top 10 gainers: SGRP +33%. CERE +32%. GTAT +15%. TWER +13%. ENPH +12%. HSOL +12%. BXE...

    Midday top 10 gainers: SGRP +33%. CERE +32%. GTAT +15%. TWER +13%. ENPH +12%. HSOL +12%. BXE +11%. IVAC +11%. MEET +10%. BIOF +10%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: NBG -22%. PPHM -21%. DCIX -9%. AMCC -9%. WHX -9%. JCTCF -8%. SIR -8%. AMS -7%. CRMD -7%. SINO -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • LEN

    Lennar (LEN +3%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at CRT Capital with a price target of...

    Lennar (LEN +3%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at CRT Capital with a price target of $48.50. Just yesterday, Goldman Sachs upped its price target on the shares following a solid FQ2 earnings report, citing better margin assumptions.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • SGRP

    Shares of Spar Group (SGRP +38.8%) spike on heavy volume. In what now looks like a particularly...

    Shares of Spar Group (SGRP +38.8%) spike on heavy volume. In what now looks like a particularly prescient call, SA Pro contributor Igor Novgorodtsev recommended the stock last week, noting that it "likely won't stay cheap for too long."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • PETX

    Aratana Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PETX) trades higher in its debut, currently over $8 after pricing...

    Aratana Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PETX) trades higher in its debut, currently over $8 after pricing its 5,750,000 share IPO at $6 per share and opening this morning at $7. The company is a development-stage biopharmaceutical company focused on prescription medications for pets. Stifel and Lazard Capital Markets are co-leads for the offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • CNX

    Consol (CNX +2.1%) claws back from YTD lows exacerbated by Pres. Obama's climate change...

    Consol (CNX +2.1%) claws back from YTD lows exacerbated by Pres. Obama's climate change speech, as CNX would stand to benefit from regulations favoring natural gas, which produces fewer carbon emissions than coal. "We'll be able to supply our customers with natural gas if that's the route [the administration] chooses to go," a VP tells WSJ. CNX currently gets ~14% of its revenue from nat gas production. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • UNG

    Natural gas (UNG -4.5%) plummets following a larger than expected inventory build as well as a...

    Natural gas (UNG -4.5%) plummets following a larger than expected inventory build as well as a continued outlook for moderate summer temperatures in the Northeast. Total stocks now stand at 2.533T cubic feet, off 522B from a year ago, and 31B below the 5-year average.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 10 Comments
  • ENMD

    EntreMed (ENMD +4.4%) pops after submitting a new drug global clinical trial application with...

    EntreMed (ENMD +4.4%) pops after submitting a new drug global clinical trial application with the China Food and Drug Administration for its oncology drug candidate, ENMD-2076. The purpose of the application is to expand Phase 2 clinical trials in advanced/metastatic sarcoma currently being conducted at Princess Margaret Hospital. CEO Dr. Ken Ren notes that expanding trials into China will enable the ENMD to explore the drug's potential at an accelerated pace, due to faster patient recruitment and lower study costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • LPI

    Laredo Petroleum (LPI +3.8%) is initiated at Brean Capital with a Buy rating and $27 price...

    Laredo Petroleum (LPI +3.8%) is initiated at Brean Capital with a Buy rating and $27 price target, which sees improving results from the horizontal Wolfcamp Shale play in the Midland Basin as the biggest driver for share-price appreciation in 2013-14. The firm also sees further delineation and de-risking of LPI's Midland Basin acreage as a catalyst.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • ACAS

    American Capital (ACAS +2.6%) logs a big gain after last night's announcement of a continued...

    American Capital (ACAS +2.6%) logs a big gain after last night's announcement of a continued fast pace of buybacks in Q2. Illustrating the quick decline in the shares over the last 2 months, the average price of purchases was more than 10% over today's price, and 3.2% less than the average buyback price in Q1. March 31 NAV was $19.04, more than 50% above the stock price this morning.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 2 Comments
  • CMC

    Commercial Metals (CMC +3.6%) climbs higher even after FQ3 missed expectations. CMC says a...

    Commercial Metals (CMC +3.6%) climbs higher even after FQ3 missed expectations. CMC says a modest improvement in rebar shipments was more than offset by weaker shipment levels of merchant and light structural products, resulting in lower profitability at its Americas Mills business. Operationally, CMC anticipates FQ4 results similar to FQ3; consensus estimates are $0.25 EPS and $1.93B in revenues.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • ZGNX

    Zogenix (ZGNX +1.8%) announces a co-promotion agreement with Valeant (VRX +1%) for the latter's...

    Zogenix (ZGNX +1.8%) announces a co-promotion agreement with Valeant (VRX +1%) for the latter's Migranal nasal spray. ZGNX will utilize its sales force to market the product to prescribers and will "be compensated in the form of a quarterly service fee that is calculated as a percentage of net sales over a baseline amount." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • XLS

    Exelis (XLS +2.2%) has received a $3.2M contract from Ball's (NYSE:BLL) Aerospace &...

    Exelis (XLS +2.2%) has received a $3.2M contract from Ball's (NYSE:BLL) Aerospace & Technologies subsidiary to design an advanced receiver chain for the U.S. Air Force Weather Satellite Follow-on program. The new design will improve measurements of ocean surface winds, which is used for severe weather forecasting.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • EPZM

    Epizyme (EPZM +2.4%) trades higher after Wedbush's Greg Wade ramps up coverage with an...

    Epizyme (EPZM +2.4%) trades higher after Wedbush's Greg Wade ramps up coverage with an Outperform rating and a $37 price target. Wade says that advances in genetically defining sub-sets of cancer patients have led to identifying certain histone methyltransferase proteins as key malignant drivers, and EPZM's small molecule drug discovery platform is key to marrying these antagonists with the genetically definable malignancy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • REGN

    Goldman's Terence Flynn says a study published in a medical journal suggests branded VEGF drugs...

    Goldman's Terence Flynn says a study published in a medical journal suggests branded VEGF drugs such as Regeneron's (REGN +2.7%) Eylea "are superior to off-label Avastin." In the cited study, patients on Lucentis realized a 13 letter improvement in vision versus an 11 letter improvement for those on Avastin.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • FLDM

    Fluidigm (FLDM +2.5%) moves up this morning after Maxim Group initiates coverage with a Buy...

    Fluidigm (FLDM +2.5%) moves up this morning after Maxim Group initiates coverage with a Buy rating and a $21 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • INVN

    InvenSense (INVN +3.1%) has indeed scored its first iPhone motion sensor design win, says OTR...

    InvenSense (INVN +3.1%) has indeed scored its first iPhone motion sensor design win, says OTR Global in a note boosting shares. Goldman, one of several firms to have already reported of or predicted an iPhone 5S win, thinks the win could lift EPS by ~60%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 3 Comments
  • CDW

    Sometimes setting the bar low is a good thing: After gradually lowering the price of its IPO to...

    Sometimes setting the bar low is a good thing: After gradually lowering the price of its IPO to $17 from a range of $20-$23, CDW opened for trading at $17.64 and is currently at $17.97, up 5.7%. That gives the giant IT hardware distributor a valuation of $3.03B, or 0.3x 2012 sales and 16x earnings. (S-1) (Q1 figures)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • TLRA

    Tremor Video's (TRMR) IPO isn't faring well. After pricing its 7.5M-share offering at $10, below...

    Tremor Video's (TRMR) IPO isn't faring well. After pricing its 7.5M-share offering at $10, below a range of $11-$13, shares opened at $11 but have quickly fallen to $9.65, which translates into a 3.5% drop. That gives the provider of online/mobile video ad tech solutions a market cap of $468M, or 4.4x 2012 sales. Tremor posted Q1 revenue of $24.8M (+43% Y/Y), and a net loss of $9.1M. Tremor's VideoHub tech analyzes online videos and their context, as well as an ad campaign's goals and performance, to deliver targeted ads. The company considers YouTube, Hulu, and video ad networks such as BrightRoll to be among its competitors. (S-1) (IPO preview)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • BIDU

    A roundup of tech ratings changes: 1) BNP Paribas has started Baidu (BIDU +1.6%) at Buy. 2)...

    A roundup of tech ratings changes: 1) BNP Paribas has started Baidu (BIDU +1.6%) at Buy. 2) Longbow has upgraded Seagate (STX +4.1%) and Western Digital (WDC +2.9%) to Buy. 3) Pac Crest has started Synchronoss (SNCR +2.9%) at Outperform. 4) Lazard has upgraded Trimble (TRMB +2.5%) to Buy. 5) BMO and RBC have downgraded Rogers (RCI -1.9%) to Market Perform/Sector Perform, and BMO has also downgraded Telus (TU -2.4%) to Market Perform. However, Stifel has upgraded Telus to Buy. (yesterday). 6) HSBC has upgraded Sohu (SOHU +3.8%) to Neutral. 7) China Mobile (CHL +1.7%) has been upgraded to Neutral by BofA/Merrill. 8) Atmel (ATML +1.4%) has been upgraded to Buy by Lazard. 9) Flir Systems (FLIR +2.1%) has been upgraded to Overweight by Stephens.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • KBH

    More on KB Home (KBH +3.7%) FQ2: Net loss narrows to $2.97M from $24.14M a year earlier. Homes...

    More on KB Home (KBH +3.7%) FQ2: Net loss narrows to $2.97M from $24.14M a year earlier. Homes delivered +39% Q/Q to 1,797; Net orders +6% Y/Y to 2,162 units; backlog +6% to 3,128 homes; average selling price +25% to $290,400, the highest for a Q2 since 2006. CEO Jeffrey Mezger is confident that KB Home will achieve "a solidly profitable 2013," with "meaningful profits" in H2, and that it "will continue to build positive momentum entering 2014."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • GTATQ

    GT Advanced Tech (GTAT) +8.8% premarket after Canaccord upgrades shares to Buy from Hold...

    GT Advanced Tech (GTAT) +8.8% premarket after Canaccord upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with a $5 price target (up from $4), saying both the economics and investor sentiment in GTAT's solar and sapphire businesses are improving. While it does not expect an explosion in solar demand, the firm foresees a tightening in polysilicon as soon as 2015 with modest solar installation growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL) +3.2% premarket after saying it netted ~$36M from finalizing its...

    FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL) +3.2% premarket after saying it netted ~$36M from finalizing its $38M debt issue to fund ongoing refinement and marketing of its alternative-power supply technologies. Shares also may be getting an assist from Toyota's (NYSE:TM) plans to introduce a new hydrogen-powered sedan at the Tokyo Auto Show in November.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM | 2 Comments

  • Market preview: European shares and U.S. stock futures are higher, with not even positive data...

    Market preview: European shares and U.S. stock futures are higher, with not even positive data for consumer spending and weekly jobless claims being able to spoil the mood. A bunch of Fed officials are due to speak today, when they'll probably trot out the party line that QE is here to stay for the time being. The S&P Mini is +0.6%. Later: Bloomberg Consumer Comfort Index, Pending Home Sales, Kansas City Fed Mfg Survey
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • YELP

    Yelp (NYSE:YELP) +2.8%, adding to yesterday's 12% gain, after Cowen says a survey points to...

    Yelp (NYSE:YELP) +2.8%, adding to yesterday's 12% gain, after Cowen says a survey points to growing local business awareness/engagement. The firm adds a majority of respondents were still unaware of Yelp, leaving plenty of room for growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM
  • CERE

    Premarket gainers: CERE +15%. GTAT +9%. UMC +7%. RSOL +5%.Losers: NBG -28%. PPHM -28%. SIR...

    Premarket gainers: CERE +15%. GTAT +9%. UMC +7%. RSOL +5%.
    Losers: NBG -28%. PPHM -28%. SIR -6%. 
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM

  • Southeast Asian shares extend Wednesday's rally amid cautious foreign buying with Philippine...

    Southeast Asian shares extend Wednesday's rally amid cautious foreign buying with Philippine equities (EPHE) leading the charge, up 3.4% in Manila. Elsewhere, Indonesian (EIDO, IDX), Thai (THD), and Malaysian (EWM) stocks rise 1.9%, 1.55%, and 0.62% respectively, while the Straits Times (EWS, EWSS) creeps up 0.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • T

    Shares of DirecTV (NYSE:DTV) are down 3.6% premarket after the company disclosed that its unit...

    Shares of DirecTV (NYSE:DTV) are down 3.6% premarket after the company disclosed that its unit in Latin America reported subscribers numbers which were boosted higher by artificial means. Shares of DTV hit an all-time high after growth in Latin America helped the company beat Q1 profit estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharmaceutical (CPRX +3.3%) reiterates that it expects to complete the enrollment of 36...

    Catalyst Pharmaceutical (CPRX +3.3%) reiterates that it expects to complete the enrollment of 36 patients in the Phase III trial of the Firdapse drug for Lambert-Eaton Myasthenic Syndrome, a rare and sometimes fatal autoimmune disease characterized by muscle weakness, during Q4 2013. Assuming all goes well, Catalyst expects to file an NDA for Firdapse in Q1 2015, obtain FDA authorization at the end of that year, and launch the treatment in H1 2016. (PR)
